required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of Dasatinib in Chronic Phase Philadelphia Chromosome Positive Chronic Myeloid Leukemia
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Multicenter, Open-label Phase II Study of Dasatinib (BMS-354825) Administered Orally at a Dose of 50mg Twice Daily or 100mg Once Daily in Subjects With Chronic Phase Philadelphia Chromosome Positive Chronic Myeloid Leukemia Who Are Resistant or Intolerant to Imatinib

brief_summary.textblock: The objective is to evaluate the cytogenetic response to Dasatinib (BMS-354825) administered for 24 weeks in subjects with Imatinib resistant or intolerant chronic phase chronic myeloid leukemia (CML) once daily (QD) or twice daily. (BID)

primary_outcome.measure: Cytogenetic Response in Imatinib-Intolerant and Imatinib-Resistant Participants at Week 24
primary_outcome.description: Cytogenetic responses (CyR) are based on the percentage of Philadelphia-positive (Ph+) metaphases among at least 20 metaphase cells in each bone marrow (BM) sample. The criteria for cytogenetic responses are as follows. Best CyR is defined as the best response obtained at any time during the study. Major Cytogenetic Response (MCyR) = Complete Cytogenetic Response (CCyR; 0 Ph+ Cells in Metaphase in BM), and Partial Cytogenetic Response (PCyR; 1 - 35 Ph+ Cells in Metaphase in BM).

secondary_outcome.measure: Adverse Events (AEs), Serious Adverse Events (SAEs), Discontinuations, and Deaths During Treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Throughout study period to last observation. Dosing period=6 months; if beneficial, medication may continue in the extension period (ending in January 2009). Last observation=30 days past last dosing day or the discontinuation day.
secondary_outcome.description: AE=any new untoward medical occurrence or worsening of a pre-existing medical condition which does not necessarily have a causal relationship with this treatment. Related AE=relationship of certain, probable, possible, or missing. SAE=any untoward medical occurrence that at any dose: results in death, is life-threatening, requires inpatient hospitalization or causes prolongation of existing hospitalization, results in persistent or significant disability/incapacity, is a congenital anomaly/birth defect, results in the development of drug dependency or drug abuse, is an important medical event.

secondary_outcome.measure: Complete Hematologic Response (CHR) in Imatinib-Intolerant and Imatinib-Resistant Participants at Week 24
secondary_outcome.description: CHR=all of the following criteria: white blood cell count ≤ institutional upper limit of normal; platelets < 450,000/mm³; no blasts or promyelocytes in peripheral blood; < 5% myelocytes plus metamyelocytes in peripheral blood; peripheral blood basophils < 20%; no extramedullary involvement. A confirmed CHR (cCHR) is obtained when all above criteria are maintained for at least 28 days after they are first met. All hematologic responses can begin only 14 days after the dosing start date.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: time from first dose of Dasatinib (BMS-354825) until the first day criteria for CCyR or PCyR, whichever occurs first, are first met
secondary_outcome.description: Time to MCyR is defined as the time from first dose of Dasatinib (BMS-354825) until the first day criteria for CCyR or PCyR, whichever occurs first, are first met. MCyR = a complete and a partial cytogenetic response (CyR), based on the percentage of Ph+ metaphases among at least 20 metaphase cells in each bone marrow sample. Percentage of Ph+ Cells in Metaphase in bone marrow: Complete Cytogenetic Response (CCyR) = 0; Partial Cytogenetic Response (PCyR) 1 - 35

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetics of Dasatinib (BMS-354825) as Characterized by Population Pharmacokinetics
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Six or more peripheral blood samples were collected at any visit after Day 7, pre-dose and 5 - 8 hours after dose administration.
secondary_outcome.description: Blood sample collection for pharmacokinetic (PK) analysis that will contribute to PK modeling.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: from the first day all criteria are met for CCyR or PCyR until the date of progressed disease (PD) or death
secondary_outcome.description: The duration of MCyR will be measured from the first day all criteria are met for CCyR or PCyR until the date of progressed disease (PD) or death. Subjects who neither progress nor die will be censored on the date of their last cytogenetic assessment.MCyR = a complete and a partial cytogenetic response (CyR), based on the percentage of Ph+ metaphases among at least 20 metaphase cells in each bone marrow sample. Percentage of Philadelphia-positive (Ph+) Cells in Metaphase in bone marrow: Complete Cytogenetic Response (CCyR) = 0; Partial Cytogenetic Response (PCyR) 1 - 35

secondary_outcome.time_frame: time from first dose of Dasatinib (BMS-354825) until the first day CHR criteria are met
secondary_outcome.description: Time to CHR = time from first dose of Dasatinib until the first day CHR criteria are met (provided subjects achieved a cCHR). CHR=all of the following criteria: white blood cell count ≤ upper limit of normal; platelets <450,000/mm³; no blasts or promyelocytes in peripheral blood; <5% myelocytes plus metamyelocytes in peripheral blood; peripheral blood basophils <20%; no extramedullary involvement. A confirmed CHR (cCHR) is obtained when all above criteria are maintained for at least 28 days after they are first met. All hematologic responses can begin only 14 days after the dosing start date.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: measured from the first day all criteria were first met for CHR (provided subjects achieved a cCHR), until the date PD is first reported or until death
secondary_outcome.description: The duration of CHR were measured from the first day all criteria were first met for CHR (provided subjects achieved a cCHR), until the date PD is first reported or until death. Subjects who neither progress nor die were censored on the date of their last hematologic assessment.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: time from first dose of Dasatinib (BMS-354825) until the first day criteria for CCyR or PCyR, whichever occurs first, are first met
secondary_outcome.description: Progressed disease=achieving a CHR & subsequently no longer meeting criteria consistently over a consecutive 2-week period after starting maximum dose; no CHR after receiving maximum dose & increase in white blood cell count (doubling of count from lowest value to >20,000/mm3 or an increase by >50,000/mm3 on 2 assessments done ≥2 weeks apart); meeting the criteria of accelerated or blastic phase chronic myeloid leukemia at any time; having an MCyR & subsequently no longer meeting the criteria for MCyR after starting maximum dose; or having a >=30% absolute increase in number of Ph+ metaphases.

secondary_outcome.measure: Expression of BCR-ABL Gene Mutations of RNA (mRNA)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and at the end of long term extension period (The enrollment period was followed by an extension period until the launch of dasatinib in Japan, January 2009.)
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants with positive (>= 2.0 log copies/mg) and negative (<2.0 log copies/mg) expression of mRNA at Baseline and at end of study.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and at the end of long term extension period (The enrollment period was followed by an extension period until the launch of dasatinib in Japan, January 2009.)
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants with a particular BCR-ABL mutation at Baseline and End-of-Study.

secondary_outcome.measure: Cytogenetic Response in Imatinib-Intolerant and Imatinib-Resistant Participants at End of Study
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and at the end of long term extension period (The enrollment period was followed by an extension period until the launch of dasatinib in Japan, January 2009.)
secondary_outcome.description: Cytogenetic response (CyR) as reflected in the major cytogenetic response was determined by bone marrow (BM) aspirates and are based on the percentage of Ph+ metaphases among at least 20 metaphase cells in each BM sample. Major Cytogenetic Response (MCyR) = Complete Cytogenetic Response (CCyR; 0 Ph+ Cells in Metaphase in BM), or Partial Cytogenetic Response (PCyR; 1 - 35 Ph+ Cells in Metaphase in BM).

secondary_outcome.measure: Hematologic Response in Imatinib-Intolerant and Imatinib-Resistant Participants at End of Study
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and at the end of long term extension period (The enrollment period was followed by an extension period until the launch of dasatinib in Japan, January 2009.)
secondary_outcome.description: CHR=all of the following criteria: white blood cell count ≤ institutional upper limit of normal; platelets < 450,000/mm³; no blasts or promyelocytes in peripheral blood; < 5% myelocytes plus metamyelocytes in peripheral blood; peripheral blood basophils < 20%; no extramedullary involvement. A confirmed CHR (cCHR) is obtained when all above criteria are maintained for at least 28 days after they are first met. All hematologic responses can begin only 14 days after the dosing start date.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Philadelphia chromosome positive or bcr-abl gene positive Chronic phase Chronic Myelogenous Leukemia (CML) subjects must have primary or acquired resistance to Imatinib mesylate or have intolerance of imatinib mesylate
- Performance status (general conditions) specified by the Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group: 0-2
- Men and women, ages 20 to 75
- Women of childbearing potential (WOCBP) must be using an adequate method of contraception to avoid pregnancy throughout the study and for up to 3 months after the study in such a manner that the risk of pregnancy is minimized
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subjects who are eligible and willing to undergo transplantation at pre-study
- Women who are pregnant or breastfeeding
- Uncontrolled or significant cardiovascular disease
- History of significant bleeding disorder unrelated to CML
- Adequate hepatic function
- Adequate renal function
- Medication that increases bleeding risk
- Medication that changes heart rhythms
- Subjects who are compulsory detained for legal reasons or treatment of either a psychiatric or physical (e.g., infectious disease) illness must not be enrolled into this study

link.description: For FDA Safety Alerts and Recalls refer to the following link: http://www.fda.gov/MEDWATCH/safety.htm

clinical_study.keyword: Imatinib resistant or intolerant chronic phase CML

group.title: Dasatinib 100 mg Once-daily (QD) Starting Dose
group.description: Starting dose of 100 mg QD oral continuous daily dosing of Dasatinib (BMS-354825) for 24 weeks. One dose escalation allowed for nonresponding participants; dose reduction mandated according to the observed toxicity.

group.title: Dasatinib 50 mg Twice-daily (BID) Starting Dose
group.description: Starting dose of 50 mg BID oral continuous daily dosing of Dasatinib (BMS-354825) for 24 weeks. One dose escalation allowed for nonresponding participants; dose reduction mandated according to the observed toxicity.

group.title: Dasatinib 100 mg Once-daily (QD) Starting Dose
group.description: Starting dose of 100 mg QD oral continuous daily dosing of Dasatinib (BMS-354825) for 24 weeks. One dose escalation allowed for nonresponding participants; dose reduction mandated according to the observed toxicity.

group.title: Dasatinib 50 mg Twice-daily (BID) Starting Dose
group.description: Starting dose of 50 mg BID oral continuous daily dosing of Dasatinib (BMS-354825) for 24 weeks. One dose escalation allowed for nonresponding participants; dose reduction mandated according to the observed toxicity.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Age
Age, Customized
Gender
Region of Enrollment
Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group Performace Status (ECOG-PS)
measure.description: ECOG PS scale is a 6-item scale to assess disease progression, daily functioning, and appropriate treatment and prognosis. Scale=0-5, with 0=fully active, 1=restricted in physically strenuous activity but ambulatory, 2=ambulatory and capable of all selfcare but unable to work, 3= limited selfcare ability and confined to bed/chair >50% of waking hours, 4=completely disabled and no selfcare ability and confined to bed/chair, and 5=death

measure.title: Imatinib Status
measure.description: Resistance to Imatinib=Previously treated with imatinib at a dose of ≥ 400 mg/day AND developed progressive disease while receiving imatinib at that dose. Intolerance to Imatinib=development of a Grade ≥3 toxicity considered at least possibly related to imatinib at a dose of ≤400 mg/day which led to discontinuation of therapy.

outcome.description: Cytogenetic responses (CyR) are based on the percentage of Philadelphia-positive (Ph+) metaphases among at least 20 metaphase cells in each bone marrow (BM) sample. The criteria for cytogenetic responses are as follows. Best CyR is defined as the best response obtained at any time during the study. Major Cytogenetic Response (MCyR) = Complete Cytogenetic Response (CCyR; 0 Ph+ Cells in Metaphase in BM), and Partial Cytogenetic Response (PCyR; 1 - 35 Ph+ Cells in Metaphase in BM).

outcome.title: Time to Major Cytogenetic Response (MCyR)
outcome.description: Time to MCyR is defined as the time from first dose of Dasatinib (BMS-354825) until the first day criteria for CCyR or PCyR, whichever occurs first, are first met. MCyR = a complete and a partial cytogenetic response (CyR), based on the percentage of Ph+ metaphases among at least 20 metaphase cells in each bone marrow sample. Percentage of Ph+ Cells in Metaphase in bone marrow: Complete Cytogenetic Response (CCyR) = 0; Partial Cytogenetic Response (PCyR) 1 - 35

outcome.title: Pharmacokinetics of Dasatinib (BMS-354825) as Characterized by Population Pharmacokinetics
outcome.description: Blood sample collection for pharmacokinetic (PK) analysis that will contribute to PK modeling.
outcome.time_frame: Six or more peripheral blood samples were collected at any visit after Day 7, pre-dose and 5 - 8 hours after dose administration.
outcome.population: Blood samples were collected for PK to be included in separate population PK analyses. No study specific PK analyses were planned for this report.

outcome.title: Duration of MCyR
outcome.description: The duration of MCyR will be measured from the first day all criteria are met for CCyR or PCyR until the date of progressed disease (PD) or death. Subjects who neither progress nor die will be censored on the date of their last cytogenetic assessment.MCyR = a complete and a partial cytogenetic response (CyR), based on the percentage of Ph+ metaphases among at least 20 metaphase cells in each bone marrow sample. Percentage of Philadelphia-positive (Ph+) Cells in Metaphase in bone marrow: Complete Cytogenetic Response (CCyR) = 0; Partial Cytogenetic Response (PCyR) 1 - 35
outcome.time_frame: from the first day all criteria are met for CCyR or PCyR until the date of progressed disease (PD) or death
outcome.population: Median duration was not reached at the time of this report; see Outcome Measure 14 for corresponding life table.

outcome.title: Progression-Free Survival (PFS)
outcome.description: Progressed disease=achieving a CHR & subsequently no longer meeting criteria consistently over a consecutive 2-week period after starting maximum dose; no CHR after receiving maximum dose & increase in white blood cell count (doubling of count from lowest value to >20,000/mm3 or an increase by >50,000/mm3 on 2 assessments done ≥2 weeks apart); meeting the criteria of accelerated or blastic phase chronic myeloid leukemia at any time; having an MCyR & subsequently no longer meeting the criteria for MCyR after starting maximum dose; or having a >=30% absolute increase in number of Ph+ metaphases.
outcome.time_frame: time from first dose of Dasatinib (BMS-354825) until the first day criteria for CCyR or PCyR, whichever occurs first, are first met
outcome.population: Median months of progression-free survival was not reached at the time of this report. See corresponding life table in Outcome Measure 16.

group.description: All participants treated with a starting Dasatinib (BMS-354825) dose of 50 mg BID oral continuous daily dosing (CCD) for 24 weeks.

measure.title: Mutational Spectrum of BCR-ABL
measure.description: Number of participants with a particular BCR-ABL mutation at Baseline and End-of-Study.

outcome.title: Cytogenetic Response in Imatinib-Intolerant and Imatinib-Resistant Participants at End of Study
outcome.description: Cytogenetic response (CyR) as reflected in the major cytogenetic response was determined by bone marrow (BM) aspirates and are based on the percentage of Ph+ metaphases among at least 20 metaphase cells in each BM sample. Major Cytogenetic Response (MCyR) = Complete Cytogenetic Response (CCyR; 0 Ph+ Cells in Metaphase in BM), or Partial Cytogenetic Response (PCyR; 1 - 35 Ph+ Cells in Metaphase in BM).
outcome.time_frame: Baseline and at the end of long term extension period (The enrollment period was followed by an extension period until the launch of dasatinib in Japan, January 2009.)

group.title: Dasatinib 100 mg QD Starting Dose Cohort
group.description: All participants treated with a starting dose of Dasatinib (BMS-354825) 100 mg QD oral continuous daily dosing (CCD) for 24 weeks.

group.title: Dasatinib 50 mg BID Starting Dose Cohort
group.description: All participants treated with a starting Dasatinib (BMS-354825) dose of 50 mg BID oral continuous daily dosing (CCD) for 24 weeks.

measure.title: Cytogenetic Response in Imatinib-Intolerant and Imatinib-Resistant Participants at End of Study
measure.description: Cytogenetic response (CyR) as reflected in the major cytogenetic response was determined by bone marrow (BM) aspirates and are based on the percentage of Ph+ metaphases among at least 20 metaphase cells in each BM sample. Major Cytogenetic Response (MCyR) = Complete Cytogenetic Response (CCyR; 0 Ph+ Cells in Metaphase in BM), or Partial Cytogenetic Response (PCyR; 1 - 35 Ph+ Cells in Metaphase in BM).

outcome.title: Hematologic Response in Imatinib-Intolerant and Imatinib-Resistant Participants at End of Study
outcome.description: CHR=all of the following criteria: white blood cell count ≤ institutional upper limit of normal; platelets < 450,000/mm³; no blasts or promyelocytes in peripheral blood; < 5% myelocytes plus metamyelocytes in peripheral blood; peripheral blood basophils < 20%; no extramedullary involvement. A confirmed CHR (cCHR) is obtained when all above criteria are maintained for at least 28 days after they are first met. All hematologic responses can begin only 14 days after the dosing start date.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline and at the end of long term extension period (The enrollment period was followed by an extension period until the launch of dasatinib in Japan, January 2009.)

group.title: Dasatinib 100 mg QD Starting Dose Cohort
group.description: All participants treated with a starting dose of Dasatinib (BMS-354825) 100 mg QD oral continuous daily dosing (CCD) for 24 weeks.

group.title: Dasatinib 50 mg BID Starting Dose Cohort
group.description: All participants treated with a starting Dasatinib (BMS-354825) dose of 50 mg BID oral continuous daily dosing (CCD) for 24 weeks.

measure.title: Hematologic Response in Imatinib-Intolerant and Imatinib-Resistant Participants at End of Study
measure.description: CHR=all of the following criteria: white blood cell count ≤ institutional upper limit of normal; platelets < 450,000/mm³; no blasts or promyelocytes in peripheral blood; < 5% myelocytes plus metamyelocytes in peripheral blood; peripheral blood basophils < 20%; no extramedullary involvement. A confirmed CHR (cCHR) is obtained when all above criteria are maintained for at least 28 days after they are first met. All hematologic responses can begin only 14 days after the dosing start date.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Major Cytogenetic Response at Months 0 - 24 (Duration of MCyR Life Table)
outcome.description: MCyR = a complete and a partial cytogenetic response (CyR), based on the percentage of Ph+ metaphases among at least 20 metaphase cells in each bone marrow sample. Percentage of Ph+ Cells in Metaphase in BM: Complete Cytogenetic Response (CCyR) = 0; Partial Cytogenetic Response (PCyR) 1 - 35
outcome.population: Treated participants. Median duration was not reached at the time of this report (see Outcome Measure 6)

group.description: All participants treated with a starting dose of Dasatinib (BMS-354825) 100 mg QD oral continuous daily dosing (CCD) for 24 weeks.

measure.description: MCyR = a complete and a partial cytogenetic response (CyR), based on the percentage of Ph+ metaphases among at least 20 metaphase cells in each bone marrow sample. Percentage of Ph+ Cells in Metaphase in BM: Complete Cytogenetic Response (CCyR) = 0; Partial Cytogenetic Response (PCyR) 1 - 35
measure.population: Treated participants. Median duration was not reached at the time of this report (see Outcome Measure 6)

outcome.title: Number of Participants With CHR at Months 0 - 24 (Duration of MCyR Life Table)
outcome.description: CHR=all of the following criteria: white blood cell count ≤ institutional upper limit of normal; platelets < 450,000/mm³; no blasts or promyelocytes in peripheral blood; < 5% myelocytes plus metamyelocytes in peripheral blood; peripheral blood basophils < 20%; no extramedullary involvement. A confirmed CHR (cCHR) is obtained when all above criteria are maintained for at least 28 days after they are first met. All hematologic responses can begin only 14 days after the dosing start date.
outcome.population: Treated participants. Median duration was not reached at the time of this report (see Outcome Measure 7)

group.title: Dasatinib 100 mg QD Starting Dose Cohort
group.description: All participants treated with a starting dose of Dasatinib (BMS-354825) 100 mg QD oral continuous daily dosing (CCD) for 24 weeks.

group.title: Dasatinib 50 mg BID Starting Dose Cohort
group.description: All participants treated with a starting Dasatinib (BMS-354825) dose of 50 mg BID oral continuous daily dosing (CCD) for 24 weeks.

measure.title: Number of Participants With CHR at Months 0 - 24 (Duration of MCyR Life Table)
measure.description: CHR=all of the following criteria: white blood cell count ≤ institutional upper limit of normal; platelets < 450,000/mm³; no blasts or promyelocytes in peripheral blood; < 5% myelocytes plus metamyelocytes in peripheral blood; peripheral blood basophils < 20%; no extramedullary involvement. A confirmed CHR (cCHR) is obtained when all above criteria are maintained for at least 28 days after they are first met. All hematologic responses can begin only 14 days after the dosing start date.
measure.population: Treated participants. Median duration was not reached at the time of this report (see Outcome Measure 7)

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Progression-Free Survival (PFS) at Months 0 - 24 (PFS Life Table)
outcome.description: Progressed disease=achieving a CHR and subsequently no longer meeting criteria consistently over a consecutive 2-week period after starting maximum dose; no CHR after receiving maximum dose and an increase in white blood cell count (doubling of the count from lowest value to >20,000/mm3 or an increase by >50,000/mm3 on 2 assessments done at least 2 weeks apart); meeting the criteria of accelerated or blastic phase CML at any time; having an MCyR and subsequently no longer meeting the criteria for MCyR after starting maximum dose; or having a >=30% absolute increase in number of Ph+ metaphases.
outcome.population: Treated participants. Median duration was not reached at the time of this report (see Outcome Measure 7)

group.title: Dasatinib 100 mg QD Starting Dose Cohort
group.description: All participants treated with a starting dose of Dasatinib (BMS-354825) 100 mg QD oral continuous daily dosing (CCD) for 24 weeks.

group.title: Dasatinib 50 mg BID Starting Dose Cohort
group.description: All participants treated with a starting Dasatinib (BMS-354825) dose of 50 mg BID oral continuous daily dosing (CCD) for 24 weeks.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Progression-Free Survival (PFS) at Months 0 - 24 (PFS Life Table)
measure.description: Progressed disease=achieving a CHR and subsequently no longer meeting criteria consistently over a consecutive 2-week period after starting maximum dose; no CHR after receiving maximum dose and an increase in white blood cell count (doubling of the count from lowest value to >20,000/mm3 or an increase by >50,000/mm3 on 2 assessments done at least 2 weeks apart); meeting the criteria of accelerated or blastic phase CML at any time; having an MCyR and subsequently no longer meeting the criteria for MCyR after starting maximum dose; or having a >=30% absolute increase in number of Ph+ metaphases.
measure.population: Treated participants. Median duration was not reached at the time of this report (see Outcome Measure 7)

group.title: Dasatinib 100 mg Once-daily (QD) Starting Dose
group.description: Starting dose of 100 mg QD oral continuous daily dosing of Dasatinib (BMS-354825) for 24 weeks. One dose escalation allowed for nonresponding participants; dose reduction mandated according to the observed toxicity.

group.title: Dasatinib 50 mg Twice-daily (BID) Starting Dose
group.description: Starting dose of 50 mg BID oral continuous daily dosing of Dasatinib (BMS-354825) for 24 weeks. One dose escalation allowed for nonresponding participants; dose reduction mandated according to the observed toxicity.

group.title: Total

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)
Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Bristol-Myers Squibb Co. agreements with investigators vary; constant is our right to embargo communications regarding trial results prior to public release for a period ≤60 days from submittal for review. We will not prohibit investigators from publishing, but will prohibit the disclosure of previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results, and request postponement of single-center publications until after disclosure of the clinical trial's primary publication.
